valueContactDetail.name: HL7 US Realm Program Management Author

name: EthnicityCategories
title: Ethnicity Categories
publisher: HL7 US Realm Program Management Steward
description: The HL7 OID used in the US Core Implementation Guide value set (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ValueSet/omb-ethnicity-category) has been retained here, as the value set content is identical. However, the preferred reference is now the VSAC-hosted version, since both US Core and C-CDA will reference this set going forward. Additionally, the US Core IG-based value set does not currently support expansion, making the VSAC version more suitable for implementation.
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This value set includes concepts representing ethnicity categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) in its 1997 standards for race and ethnicity data collection. The standard defines two categories: Hispanic or Latino and Not Hispanic or Latino. These are specified in OMB Statistical Policy Directive No. 15 (62 FR 58782, October 30, 1997).
Reference: OMB 1997 Standards â€“ Federal Register (https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf)
This value set also includes concepts for when ethnicity is unknown or when an individual does not know or declines to respond.),(Data Element Scope: This set of values is limited to capturing ethnicity as either Hispanic or Latino, or Not Hispanic or Latino, in alignment with federal standards. It also includes the ability to document when ethnicity is unknown or when the individual does not know or declines to provide this information.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes codes from the CDCREC code system that represent Hispanic or Latino and Not Hispanic or Latino, along with HL7 nullFlavor codes ASKU (asked but unknown) and UNK (unknown) and Asked-Declined from the FHIR Data Absent Reason Code system.),(Exclusion Criteria: No other CDCREC codes or HL7 Null values are included.)
